channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | World Edition
channel.description: Updated every minute of every day
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Charged aide quits Cheney office
item.description: A top White House aide quits after he is charged with perjury over a probe into the unmasking of a CIA agent.

item.title: UN raps Iran's anti-Israel rant
item.description: The UN Security Council condemns Iran's president over his call for Israel to be "wiped off the map".

item.title: Bolivia row forces election delay
item.description: Bolivia's general election, which was due in December, is postponed amid a row over seat allocations.

item.title: Talks due on Kashmir aid effort
item.description: India and Pakistan are to discuss easing border controls so relief workers can reach quake-hit Kashmir.

item.title: EU offers to cut farming tariffs
item.description: Europe offers to cut farm tariffs by up to 60%, in an attempt to break the deadlock in world trade talks.

item.title: Portuguese abortion vote denied
item.description: Portugal's constitutional court scuppers next month's referendum on whether to relax abortion laws.

item.title: Ivory Coast recruiting Liberians
item.description: Ivory Coast is recruiting Liberians into its armed forces, says international pressure group, Human Rights Watch.

item.title: Rosa Parks set to lie in honour
item.description: Late civil rights icon Rosa Parks is to lie in honour in the Capitol Rotunda - the first woman to receive the tribute.

item.title: Thousands join Gaza funeral
item.description: Thousands of mourners gather in the Gaza Strip for the funerals of eight people killed in Israeli air strikes.

item.title: Golf: Montgomerie takes lead
item.description: Colin Montgomerie strengthens his bid for an eighth Order of Merit title as he takes a two-shot lead in the Volvo Masters.

item.title: Cricket: Sri Lanka crumble
item.description: Irfan Pathan takes 4-37 as India bowl Sri Lanka out for a paltry 122 in Mohali - and win by eight wickets.

item.title: Zanzibar's polls 'will go ahead'
item.description: Zanzibar's polls take place on Sunday despite the delay of mainland elections in Tanzania, the election commission says.

item.title: Somali warlord threatens planes
item.description: A Somali warlord says his militia will shoot down planes flying over Mogadishu diverted to other towns.

item.title: Nicaragua prepares for storm Beta
item.description: Homes are evacuated along Nicaragua's coast as Tropical Storm Beta threatens to strengthen a hurricane.

item.title: Bush vows no let-up in terror war
item.description: President Bush says the US will not tire in its "war on terror", but avoids commenting on his domestic woes.

item.title: China's Hu in rare N Korea visit
item.description: China's President Hu Jintao is in North Korea for talks expected to focus on reinforcing a key nuclear deal.

item.title: Japan charter reform proposed
item.description: Japan's ruling party proposes revising the country's constitution to formalise the role of its military.

item.title: Court considers Berlusconi charge
item.description: A court considers whether Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi should stand trial on corruption charges.

item.title: Belgium hit by second mass strike
item.description: Belgian workers cause widespread disruption with their second 24-hour strike this month over pension plans.

item.title: Sistani ends Shia party backing
item.description: Ayatollah Sistani, Iraq's most revered cleric, will not back any party in December's vote, an official says.

item.title: Syria renews vow to help UN probe
item.description: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad pledges co-operation with a UN inquiry after talks with his Egyptian counterpart.

item.title: Indians flee approaching cyclone
item.description: Thousands of people along India's south-east coast are evacuated, hours before a cyclone is due to hit land.

item.title: Vodafone buys into India's Bharti
item.description: Vodafone, the world's biggest mobile phone firm, buys a 10% stake in India's Bharti Tele-Ventures for $1.5bn.

item.title: Mass policy forums 'way forward'
item.description: US-style town hall meetings are being hailed as the way forward for helping form public policy as the last mass health consultation takes place.

item.title: US economy enjoys faster growth
item.description: US economic growth accelerated to 3.8% in the third quarter, driven by strong consumer and state spending.

item.title: Scientists discover dyslexia gene
item.description: Up to a fifth of dyslexia cases could be caused by a faulty version of a gene called DCDC2, scientists believe.

item.title: Italian laboratory clones 14 pigs
item.description: The Italian research group that produced the first horse clone has announced the birth of 14 pig clones.

item.title: Supercomputer doubles own record
item.description: The Blue Gene supercomputer breaks its record, doubling the calculations it can do a second to 280.6 trillion.

item.title: Legal defeat for accused Spector
item.description: Statements said to have been made by music producer Phil Spector can be used in his murder trial, a judge rules.
